original: BJÖRKMAN, Axel Hugo Svante, Civilingenjör, Sthlm, f Gamleby, Kalm län, 19/7 69 av lantbr Nils O B o Ida Carlström, gm Anna Maria Leontine Deutgen. Studex Västervik 89, KTH (väg o vatt) 89—93, tekn högsk, Darmstadt, 93—94. Anst v Gesellschaft Här-kort, Duisburg, 94—98, SJ 99—02, i USA 00, eg konstr.byrå f järnkonstr 02—06, grund o deläg av AB Arcus 06—11, vkst dir sed. 11, konstr fi st järnbroar ss jvgsbron över Storstup., landsv.bron över Klarälv v Munkfors, d:o över Bodforsen v Boden, konstr o utf fi st betongbroar ss Skurubron, viaduktombyggn v Velanda, jvgsbron v Edsvalla, landsv.bron över Ljungan v Njurunda, Riksbron i Sthlm mfl, sakk åt SJ v bygg av Årstabron, medl av fi komm f järnkonstr, betongind, entrepr.-väs mm, Styr.led i AB Fribär träkonstr, Töreboda, sed. 28, i Sv teknol.fören 12—28, v ordf i dess avd f väg- o vatt.bygg.konst 15—19, ordf i Sv betongfören 17—20, Sv cementarb.-giv.fören 17—21, v. ordf i väg- o vattenb arb.-giv.förb 17—22, ordf 22—24. Resor: Tyskl, Eng, USA 00, Frankr, Schweiz 03, Ital, Frankr 23, Västind 32 mfl. Av trycket: FI art rör entrepren.väs, järn- och betongkonstr i Tekn tidskr mfl publ. RNO, RVO, Sällsk Idun, S:t örj Gille, Travellers club, Timmermansorden, Sveaorden mfl.
translated: BJÖRKMAN, Axel Hugo Svante, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, b. Gamleby, Kalmar County, 19/7 1869, son of farmer Nils O B and Ida Carlström, m. Anna Maria Leontine Deutgen. Degree from Västervik 1889, KTH (civil engineering) 1889-1893, technical university in Darmstadt 1893-1894. Employed at Gesellschaft Här-kort, Duisburg 1894-1898, SJ (Swedish Railways) 1899-1902, in the US in 1900, founded own engineering firm for structural iron construction 1902-1906, co-founder and partner of AB Arcus 1906-1911, currently serving as Managing Director since 1911. Designed and constructed various iron bridges including the jvgs bridge over Storstup, the national highway bridge over Klarälv in Munkfors, the one in Bodforsen in Boden, as well as concrete bridges such as Skurubron, Velanda viaduct expansion, Edsvalla highway bridge, the national highway bridge over Ljungan in Njurunda, Riksbron in Stockholm, among others. Consultant for SJ (Swedish Railways) in the construction of Årstabron, member of specialized committees for iron and concrete constructions, concrete industry, and contractors, board member of AB Fribär träkonstr in Töreboda since 1928, member of the Swedish Association of Technology from 1912 to 1928, vice chairman of its road and water construction department from 1915 to 1919, chairman of the Swedish Concrete Association from 1917 to 1920, Swedish Cement Work Provider Association from 1917 to 1921, vice chairman of the road and water construction employers' association from 1917 to 1922, chairman from 1922 to 1924. Travelled to Germany, England, and the US in 1900, France, Switzerland in 1903, Italy, France in 1923, West Indies and others in 1932. Published articles about construction management and iron and concrete construction in various technical journals. Decorated with the Order of the North Star (RNO), Royal Victorian Order (RVO), member of Idun Society, St. George's Guild, Travellers Club, Order of the Carpenter, Order of Svea, among others.

memberOf.name: Road and Water Construction Employers' Association
